article:
Blonde (2022 film)
================

Blonde is a 2022 biographical drama film written and directed by Andrew Dominik. The film is based on the 2000 novel of the same name by Joyce Carol Oates, which reimagines the life of Marilyn Monroe. The film premiered at the 2022 Venice Film Festival and was released on Netflix in September 2022.

Plot
-----

The film is a fictionalized account of the life of Marilyn Monroe, played by Ana de Armas. The story is presented in a non-linear fashion, jumping back and forth in time to explore different periods of Monroe's life. The film begins with a young Marilyn, Norma Jeane, growing up in foster care and struggling with her mental health. As she grows older, she becomes a successful model and actress, taking on the persona of Marilyn Monroe.

Throughout the film, Marilyn's life is marked by struggles with her mental health, relationships, and the pressures of fame. She is shown to be vulnerable and exploited by those around her, including her managers, agents, and romantic partners. The film also explores Marilyn's relationships with powerful men, including President John F. Kennedy and his brother Robert.

The film's narrative is often fragmented and dreamlike, reflecting Marilyn's fragile mental state. The film's use of color, sound, and cinematography creates a sense of unease and disorientation, drawing the viewer into Marilyn's world.

Cast
-----

* Ana de Armas as Marilyn Monroe
* Adrien Brody as Arthur Miller
* Bobby Cannavale as Joe DiMaggio
* Xavier Samuel as Charles "Cass" Chaplin Jr.
* Julianne Nicholson as Gladys Pearl Baker
* Toby Huss as Whitey
* Sara Paxton as Miss Flynn
* David Corenswet as Monroe's lover
* Rebecca Wisocky as Yvet
* Caspar Phillipson as Joe DiMaggio's friend
* Dan Butler as I.E. Shinn
* Evan Williams as Eddy Robinson Jr.
* Tygh Runyan as Irvin Shulman
* Michael Masini as Tony Curtis
* Spencer Garrett as President John F. Kennedy
* Chris Lemmon as Fred Karger
* Ryan Vincent as Billy Wilder
* Ned Bellamy as Irving Stein
* Justice Leak as Peter Levathes

Production
------------

### Development and writing

The film was first announced in 2010, with Andrew Dominik set to write and direct. Dominik had previously written and directed The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford, which premiered at the 2007 Cannes Film Festival. Dominik had long been fascinated by the life of Marilyn Monroe and saw the project as an opportunity to explore the darker side of fame and celebrity culture.

Dominik spent several years working on the script, which was based on Joyce Carol Oates' novel of the same name. Oates' novel is a fictionalized account of Monroe's life, and Dominik drew heavily from the book in crafting his own narrative. Dominik also conducted extensive research on Monroe's life, reading biographies, watching documentaries, and speaking with people who knew her.

### Pre-production

Pre-production on the film began in 2019, with Dominik and his team scouting locations and preparing for filming. The film was shot on location in Los Angeles, New York City, and other locations in the United States and Canada.

### Casting

Ana de Armas was cast as Marilyn Monroe in 2019, after a lengthy auditioning process. De Armas had previously appeared in films such as Blade Runner 2049 and No Time to Die, but this was her first major leading role.

Adrien Brody was cast as Arthur Miller, Monroe's third husband, in 2020. Brody had previously appeared in films such as The Pianist and Midnight in Paris.

Bobby Cannavale was cast as Joe DiMaggio, Monroe's second husband, in 2020. Cannavale had previously appeared in films such as The Irishman and Ant-Man.

### Filming

Filming on the project began in August 2020 and wrapped in July 2021. The film was shot on 35mm film, with cinematographer Chayse Irvin using a combination of digital and film cameras to capture the footage.

The film's shoot was marked by several challenges, including the COVID-19 pandemic and a tight shooting schedule. Dominik and his team worked closely with the cast and crew to ensure that everyone was safe and healthy throughout the shoot.

### Music

The film's score was composed by Nick Cave and Warren Ellis, who have collaborated on numerous films and albums. The score features a combination of original music and period-specific songs, including several of Monroe's famous recordings.

Release
--------

The film premiered at the 2022 Venice Film Festival, where it received a standing ovation. The film was released on Netflix in September 2022, in over 190 countries worldwide.

Reception
----------

### Critical response

The film received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising de Armas' performance as Marilyn Monroe. The film holds a 94% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on over 200 reviews.

### Industry reception

The film was also a major hit in the film industry, with many praising Dominik's direction and the film's cinematography and production design. The film was named one of the best films of the year by several publications, including The New York Times and The Guardian.

### Cast

The cast also received widespread praise, with many praising the performances of de Armas, Brody, and Cannavale. De Armas' performance as Monroe was particularly praised, with many noting that she had fully embodied the character.

### NC-17 rating

The film received an NC-17 rating from the Motion Picture Association of America (MPAA) due to its explicit content, including several scenes of nudity and sex. The rating was seen as a major controversy, with some critics arguing that the film was too explicit and others arguing that the rating was unfair.

### Criticism about depiction of abortion

The film also faced criticism for its depiction of abortion, with some critics arguing that the film's portrayal of the procedure was too graphic and disturbing. The film's depiction of abortion was also seen as a major controversy, with some arguing that it was too explicit and others arguing that it was necessary to the story.

### Accolades

The film received several awards and nominations, including several Academy Award nominations. De Armas received a nomination for Best Actress, while the film also received nominations for Best Cinematography and Best Production Design.

article:
Tony Bennett
================

Anthony Dominick Benedetto, known professionally as Tony Bennett, was an American singer of popular music, standards, and jazz. With a career spanning over seven decades, Bennett was one of the most enduring and iconic figures in the entertainment industry. He was known for his smooth, velvety voice, impeccable phrasing, and interpretive skills, as well as his passion for painting and philanthropy.

Early Life
------------

### 1926–1943: Family and education

Tony Bennett was born on August 3, 1926, in Long Island City, Queens, New York, to John Benedetto and Anna Suraci. His father was a grocer, and his mother was a seamstress. Bennett was the eldest of three children, and his family lived in a small apartment in Queens. He grew up in a musical household, where his parents encouraged his love for singing and the arts.

Bennett attended George Washington High School in Upper Manhattan, where he began to develop his vocal skills. He was influenced by jazz and blues singers, such as Billie Holiday and Louis Armstrong, and he began to perform in local talent shows and concerts.

### 1944–1950: World War II and after

In 1944, Bennett enlisted in the United States Army, where he served in the infantry during World War II. He saw combat in Europe and was discharged in 1945. After the war, Bennett attended the American Theatre Wing, where he studied acting and singing.

In the late 1940s, Bennett began to perform in nightclubs and supper clubs in New York City. He was discovered by Bob Hope, who invited him to perform on his radio show. This exposure led to Bennett's first recording contract with Columbia Records.

Career
----------

### 1951–1959: First successes

Tony Bennett's first single, "Boulevard of Broken Dreams," was released in 1951. However, it was his 1952 single "Because of You" that brought him his first major success. The song reached number one on the Billboard charts and stayed there for 10 weeks.

Throughout the 1950s, Bennett released a string of hit singles, including "Blue Velvet," "Rags to Riches," and "Stranger in Paradise." He became a popular performer on television and in nightclubs, and he began to tour the world.

### 1954–1965: A growing artistry

In the mid-1950s, Bennett began to develop his interpretive skills as a singer. He worked with arrangers and conductors, such as Percy Faith and Count Basie, to create complex and nuanced musical arrangements.

Bennett's 1957 album "The Beat of My Heart" marked a turning point in his career. The album featured a mix of jazz and pop standards, and it showcased Bennett's growing artistry as a singer.

### 1965–1979: Years of struggle

In the mid-1960s, Bennett's popularity began to wane. He struggled with the changing musical landscape, and he was criticized for being out of touch with contemporary music.

Bennett continued to tour and record, but he faced financial difficulties and personal struggles. He turned to painting as a way to express himself creatively, and he eventually became a successful artist.

### 1979–1989: Turnaround

In 1979, Bennett's son, Danny Bennett, took over as his manager. Danny helped his father to revamp his image and to connect with a new generation of fans.

Bennett's 1986 album "The Art of Excellence" marked a major comeback. The album featured a mix of jazz and pop standards, and it showcased Bennett's enduring vocal skills.

### 1990–2006: Established career

Throughout the 1990s and 2000s, Bennett continued to tour and record. He released a string of critically acclaimed albums, including "Unplugged" (1994) and "Playin' with My Friends" (2001).

Bennett's 2002 album "A Wonderful World" won the Grammy Award for Best Traditional Pop Vocal Album. He went on to win several more Grammy Awards, including Best Traditional Pop Vocal Album for "Duets: An American Classic" (2007).

### 2006–2021: Later years and final album

In his later years, Bennett continued to tour and perform. He released several more albums, including "Duets II" (2011) and "Love for Sale" (2021).

"Love for Sale" was Bennett's final studio album, and it featured a duet with Lady Gaga. The album was a critical and commercial success, and it marked a fitting end to Bennett's long and illustrious career.

Artistry
------------

### Painting

In addition to his music, Tony Bennett was a talented painter. He began to paint in the 1940s, and he eventually became a successful artist.

Bennett's paintings are characterized by their bold colors and abstract forms. He was influenced by the work of artists such as Picasso and Matisse, and he developed a unique style that blended elements of modernism and realism.

### Musical style

Tony Bennett's musical style was characterized by his smooth, velvety voice and his interpretive skills as a singer. He was influenced by jazz and blues singers, such as Billie Holiday and Louis Armstrong, and he developed a unique style that blended elements of jazz, pop, and standards.

Bennett was known for his impeccable phrasing and his ability to connect with the lyrics of a song. He was a master of the Great American Songbook, and he recorded many of the classic standards that have become synonymous with American music.

Awards and Legacy
------------------

Tony Bennett won numerous awards throughout his career, including multiple Grammy Awards, a Primetime Emmy Award, and a Kennedy Center Honor.

Bennett's legacy extends far beyond his music. He was a devoted philanthropist, and he supported several charitable organizations throughout his life. He was also a passionate advocate for the arts, and he worked tirelessly to promote music education and appreciation.

Works
--------

### Discography

Tony Bennett released over 70 studio albums throughout his career. Some of his most notable albums include:

* "The Beat of My Heart" (1957)
* "The Art of Excellence" (1986)
* "Unplugged" (1994)
* "Playin' with My Friends" (2001)
* "A Wonderful World" (2002)
* "Duets: An American Classic" (2007)
* "Love for Sale" (2021)

### Books

Tony Bennett wrote several books throughout his career, including:

* "What the World Needs Now Is Love" (2012)
* "Life Is a Gift: The Zen of Bennett" (2012)
* "Just Getting Started" (2016)

Personal Life
-------------

Tony Bennett was married three times and had four children. He was a devoted family man, and he prioritized his relationships with his loved ones throughout his life.

Bennett was also a passionate advocate for social justice and human rights. He was a vocal critic of racism and inequality, and he worked tirelessly to promote understanding and empathy throughout his life.

Politics
----------

Tony Bennett was a longtime supporter of the Democratic Party. He was a vocal critic of Republican politicians, and he worked tirelessly to promote progressive causes throughout his life.

Bennett was also a passionate advocate for music education and appreciation. He worked tirelessly to promote music programs in schools and to support emerging artists throughout his life.

Illness and Death
------------------

Tony Bennett died on July 21, 2023, at the age of 96. He had been suffering from Alzheimer's disease for several years prior to his death, and he had been in poor health for some time.

Bennett's death was met with an outpouring of tributes and condolences from the music industry and beyond. He was remembered as a beloved singer, artist, and humanitarian, and his legacy continues to inspire and uplift people around the world.

Endorsements for the 2022 Conservative Party of Canada leadership election

The 2022 Conservative Party of Canada leadership election was held to elect a new leader of the Conservative Party of Canada. The election was called after Erin O'Toole's ousting as party leader in February 2022. The leadership election was won by Pierre Poilievre, who was declared the winner on September 10, 2022. During the leadership campaign, various individuals and organizations endorsed the different candidates. This article lists the endorsements for each of the candidates who ran in the election.

article:
Ștefan Foriș

Ștefan Foriș was a Romanian communist politician who served as the General Secretary of the Romanian Communist Party (PCR) from 1944 to 1945. His brief tenure was marked by a series of radical policies and actions that aimed to consolidate the party's power and eliminate opposition. Foriș's leadership was cut short when he was ousted and eventually killed, but his legacy continues to be debated among historians and scholars.

# Biography

## Early life

Ștefan Foriș was born on May 15, 1892, in Sânpetru de Câmpie, a small town in Transylvania, Romania. His family was of peasant origin, and his parents were illiterate. Foriș received his primary education in his hometown and later attended the Reformed College in Cluj-Napoca. After completing his studies, he worked as a teacher and later as a journalist, writing for several left-wing publications.

## PCR outlawing

In 1921, Foriș joined the newly formed Romanian Communist Party (PCR), which was banned by the authorities shortly after its inception. Foriș became a key figure in the party's underground activities, working closely with other prominent communists, including Gheorghe Cristescu and Elek Köblös. Despite the PCR's outlawed status, Foriș continued to promote Marxist-Leninist ideology through his writings and public speeches.

## "Popular front" tactic

In the early 1930s, the PCR adopted the "popular front" tactic, which aimed to create a broad coalition of left-wing parties and organizations to counter the growing threat of fascism in Romania. Foriș played a crucial role in promoting this strategy, which led to the formation of the Amicii URSS (Friends of the USSR) organization. This group brought together intellectuals, artists, and politicians who shared a common goal of promoting Soviet interests and opposing fascist ideology.

## Taking over

In 1944, Foriș became the General Secretary of the PCR, replacing Ștefan Voitec. Foriș's leadership marked a significant shift in the party's policies, as he sought to consolidate power and eliminate opposition. He implemented a series of radical measures, including the nationalization of key industries, the establishment of a new security apparatus, and the suppression of dissent.

## Resisting the resistance

Foriș's leadership was met with resistance from within the party and from other left-wing organizations. Some PCR members opposed his radical policies, while others resented his authoritarian style. Foriș responded by purging the party of his opponents, labeling them as "bourgeois" or "fascist" elements.

## Caransebeș conspiracy

In 1945, a group of PCR members, including former high-ranking officials, conspired against Foriș. The so-called Caransebeș conspiracy aimed to overthrow Foriș and restore a more moderate leadership. However, the plot was discovered, and the conspirators were arrested and put on trial.

## Capture

Foriș's leadership came to an abrupt end when he was captured by a group of PCR opponents on March 28, 1945. Foriș was taken to a secret location, where he was interrogated and eventually killed.

## Killing

The exact circumstances of Foriș's death remain unclear. Official accounts suggest that he died in a shootout with his captors, while others claim that he was executed. Foriș's body was never found, and his fate remains a topic of debate among historians.

# Legacy

## Cover-up and rumors

Foriș's death was followed by a massive cover-up, as the PCR sought to conceal the circumstances of his demise. Rumors surrounding his death spread rapidly, with some claiming that he had been killed by Soviet agents or by rival factions within the PCR.

## Rehabilitation

In the 1960s, Foriș's legacy underwent a significant reevaluation. As the PCR sought to distance itself from its Stalinist past, Foriș's role in the party's early years was reassessed. He was rehabilitated as a key figure in the PCR's struggle against fascism and as a champion of Marxist-Leninist ideology.

# Personal life and family

Foriș married twice and had two children. His first wife, Elisabeta, was a fellow communist and activist, while his second wife, Elena, was a secretary who worked for the PCR. Foriș's children, Maria and Ștefan Jr., both became involved in politics, with Maria serving as a member of the Romanian Parliament.

article:
Telangana Legislative Assembly

The Telangana Legislative Assembly is the lower house of the state legislature of Telangana, one of the 28 states of India. The assembly is composed of 119 members, who are elected by the people of Telangana through universal adult franchise. The assembly is responsible for making laws for the state, approving the state budget, and exercising parliamentary supervision over the state government.

# History

The Telangana Legislative Assembly was formed on June 2, 2014, after the bifurcation of the state of Andhra Pradesh. The assembly was constituted under the Andhra Pradesh Reorganisation Act, 2014, which was passed by the Indian Parliament in February 2014. The first session of the assembly was held on June 9, 2014, and K. Chandrashekar Rao, the leader of the Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS), was sworn in as the first Chief Minister of Telangana.

# Election Process

The members of the Telangana Legislative Assembly are elected through a direct election process. The state is divided into 119 constituencies, each of which elects one member. The elections are held every five years, unless the assembly is dissolved earlier. The Election Commission of India (ECI) is responsible for conducting the elections in a free and fair manner.

The election process involves several stages, including the issuance of the election notification, filing of nominations, scrutiny of nominations, withdrawal of nominations, and the counting of votes. The ECI also ensures that the elections are held in a peaceful and orderly manner, and that the Model Code of Conduct is enforced strictly.

# Composition

## Presiding officers

The presiding officers of the Telangana Legislative Assembly are the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker. The Speaker is the presiding officer of the assembly and is responsible for maintaining order and discipline in the house. The Speaker is also the custodian of the privileges of the house and its members. The Deputy Speaker assists the Speaker in the discharge of his duties and presides over the house in the absence of the Speaker.

## Members

The members of the Telangana Legislative Assembly are elected by the people of Telangana through universal adult franchise. The members are responsible for representing the interests of their constituents and for making laws for the state. The members are also responsible for exercising parliamentary supervision over the state government and for approving the state budget.

# List of the assemblies

The Telangana Legislative Assembly has had five assemblies since its formation in 2014. The details of the assemblies are as follows:

* First Assembly (2014-2018): The first assembly was formed on June 2, 2014, and was dissolved on September 6, 2018.
* Second Assembly (2018-2023): The second assembly was formed on October 8, 2018, and is currently in session.

# Members of Legislative Assembly

The members of the Telangana Legislative Assembly are elected by the people of Telangana through universal adult franchise. The members are responsible for representing the interests of their constituents and for making laws for the state. The members are also responsible for exercising parliamentary supervision over the state government and for approving the state budget.

The members of the assembly are from different parties, including the Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS), the Indian National Congress (INC), and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). The members are also from different backgrounds, including politics, social work, and business.

# See also

* Indian National Congress
* Bharatiya Janata Party

# Notes

The assembly is responsible for making laws for the state, approving the state budget, and exercising parliamentary supervision over the state government. The members of the assembly are elected by the people of Telangana through universal adult franchise, and are responsible for representing the interests of their constituents.

2023 Korea Open (badminton)

The tournament was held at the Palma Stadium in Suncheon, South Korea. The stadium has a seating capacity of 3,000 and was previously used as a venue for the 2017 BWF World Championships.

article:
Timeline of Sydney

Sydney, the capital of New South Wales and the most populous city in Australia, has a rich and diverse history spanning thousands of years. From its indigenous roots to its current status as a global city, Sydney has undergone significant transformations over the centuries. This timeline provides a comprehensive overview of the major events, milestones, and developments that have shaped the city into what it is today.

# Pre-Colonial

The area now known as Sydney has been inhabited by indigenous Australians for at least 30,000 years. The traditional owners of the land are the Eora people, who had a complex and thriving society based on a deep understanding of the local environment. The Eora people had a rich culture, with their own language, customs, and traditions. They lived in harmony with the land, using the natural resources to sustain themselves.

In the centuries leading up to European settlement, the Eora people had encounters with visiting fishermen and traders from other parts of Australia and the Pacific. However, it was not until the arrival of the British in the late 18th century that the Eora people's way of life was significantly disrupted.

# 18th–19th centuries

## 1770s–1790s

In 1770, British explorer Captain James Cook arrived in Sydney Harbour, marking the beginning of European settlement in Australia. Cook's expedition was followed by the establishment of a penal colony in 1788, with the arrival of the First Fleet. The colony was established at Sydney Cove, which was chosen for its natural harbor and access to fresh water.

The early years of the colony were marked by struggles with the indigenous population, as well as difficulties in establishing a viable economy. However, the colony slowly began to grow, with the establishment of farming, trade, and commerce.

## 1800s–1840s

During the early 19th century, Sydney experienced significant growth and development. The colony was officially declared a free settlement in 1820, and the British government began to invest in infrastructure and public works. The construction of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the establishment of the University of Sydney, and the development of the city's port facilities were all major projects that helped to establish Sydney as a major urban center.

The gold rush of the 1850s brought a significant influx of immigrants to Sydney, leading to rapid growth and development. The city became a major commercial center, with a thriving economy based on trade, finance, and industry.

## 1850s–1890s

The late 19th century saw significant changes in Sydney, with the city becoming a major cultural and intellectual center. The establishment of the Sydney Opera House, the Art Gallery of New South Wales, and the Australian Museum were all major cultural institutions that helped to establish Sydney as a hub of artistic and intellectual activity.

The city also experienced significant social and economic changes, with the rise of the labor movement and the establishment of trade unions. The city's economy continued to grow, with the development of new industries and the expansion of existing ones.

# 20th century

## 1900s–1940s

The early 20th century saw significant changes in Sydney, with the city becoming a major urban center. The construction of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, which was completed in 1932, was a major engineering feat that helped to establish the city as a major transportation hub.

During World War II, Sydney played an important role as a military base and supply depot. The city was also a major center for the production of war materials, with the establishment of new industries and factories.

## 1950s–1990s

The post-war period saw significant changes in Sydney, with the city becoming a major multicultural center. The city experienced significant immigration from Europe and other parts of the world, leading to the establishment of new communities and cultural institutions.

The city also experienced significant economic changes, with the rise of the service sector and the decline of traditional industries. The city became a major center for finance, technology, and commerce, with the establishment of new industries and companies.

# 21st century

## 2000s

The 21st century saw significant changes in Sydney, with the city becoming a major global city. The city hosted the Olympic Games in 2000, which was a major international event that helped to establish Sydney as a major tourist destination.

The city also experienced significant economic changes, with the rise of the financial sector and the decline of traditional industries. The city became a major center for finance, technology, and commerce, with the establishment of new industries and companies.

## 2010s

The 2010s saw significant changes in Sydney, with the city becoming a major hub for technology and innovation. The establishment of new industries and companies, such as the technology sector, helped to drive economic growth and development.

The city also experienced significant cultural changes, with the rise of new cultural institutions and events. The establishment of new museums, galleries, and festivals helped to establish Sydney as a major cultural center.

## 2020s

The 2020s saw significant changes in Sydney, with the city becoming a major hub for sustainability and environmentalism. The city experienced significant challenges, including climate change, bushfires, and the COVID-19 pandemic.

However, the city also experienced significant opportunities, with the establishment of new industries and companies focused on sustainability and environmentalism. The city became a major center for renewable energy, green technology, and sustainable development.

article:
Uvalde School Shooting

On May 24, 2022, a mass shooting occurred at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas, United States. The shooting resulted in the deaths of 19 children and two teachers, making it one of the deadliest school shootings in U.S. history. The incident has sparked widespread outrage, calls for gun control, and intense scrutiny of law enforcement's response.

# Background

## School security preparations

In the years leading up to the shooting, Robb Elementary School had taken various measures to enhance security. The school had installed metal detectors, surveillance cameras, and secure doors. However, a report by the Texas School Safety Center found that the school had not conducted a required security audit in the 2021-2022 school year. Additionally, the school's security plan did not include a clear protocol for responding to an active shooter.

# Events

## Shooting

On May 24, 2022, 18-year-old Salvador Ramos arrived at Robb Elementary School around 11:30 a.m. Ramos, who was armed with an AR-15-style rifle and wearing a bulletproof vest, crashed his truck into a ditch near the school. He then entered the school through an unlocked door and made his way to a classroom on the second floor.

Ramos began shooting students and teachers in the classroom, killing 11 students and two teachers. He also shot and injured several others. The shooting lasted for approximately 45 minutes before law enforcement breached the classroom and killed Ramos.

## Additional emergency response

Emergency services were alerted to the shooting at 11:31 a.m. Police officers from the Uvalde Police Department and the Uvalde Consolidated Independent School District Police Department were the first to respond to the scene. They were followed by officers from the Texas Department of Public Safety (DPS) and the U.S. Border Patrol.

## Account by Pedro Arredondo

Pedro Arredondo, the chief of police for the Uvalde Consolidated Independent School District, was the incident commander during the shooting. Arredondo claimed that he was waiting for backup and specialized equipment before entering the classroom. However, this account has been disputed by other law enforcement officials and witnesses.

## Timeline of events

* 11:30 a.m.: Ramos arrives at Robb Elementary School and crashes his truck into a ditch.
* 11:31 a.m.: Emergency services are alerted to the shooting.
* 11:35 a.m.: Police officers from the Uvalde Police Department and the Uvalde Consolidated Independent School District Police Department respond to the scene.
* 11:40 a.m.: Officers from the Texas DPS and the U.S. Border Patrol arrive at the scene.
* 12:15 p.m.: Law enforcement breaches the classroom and kills Ramos.

# Victims

* 19 children, aged 9-11
* 2 teachers, aged 44 and 48

# Perpetrator

Salvador Ramos was an 18-year-old high school dropout who lived with his grandparents in Uvalde. He had a history of behavioral problems and had been bullied in school. Ramos had purchased the AR-15-style rifle used in the shooting just days before the attack.

# Investigations

## Texas House Investigative Committee

The Texas House of Representatives established a committee to investigate the shooting and law enforcement's response. The committee's report found that law enforcement's delay in entering the classroom was a critical failure.

## Attempts to block release of police records

The Uvalde Police Department and the Texas DPS have attempted to block the release of police records related to the shooting. However, a court has ordered the release of some records.

## Hallway video

A video taken from a hallway camera shows law enforcement officers entering the school and waiting outside the classroom where Ramos was shooting students and teachers. The video has sparked widespread outrage and calls for greater transparency.

# Legal proceedings

Ramos' mother, Adriana Reyes, has been charged with evidence tampering related to the shooting. Ramos' father, Salvador Ramos Sr., has not been charged.

# Aftermath

## Memorials and tributes

Memorials and tributes have been held for the victims of the shooting. President Joe Biden has ordered flags to be flown at half-staff in honor of the victims.

## Pedro Arredondo

Pedro Arredondo has been placed on administrative leave pending an investigation into his actions during the shooting.

## Permanent closing of school

Robb Elementary School will be permanently closed and replaced with a new school.

## Potential copycat threats

There have been reports of potential copycat threats in the aftermath of the shooting.

## Departures of other officers

Several other law enforcement officers have left their jobs in the aftermath of the shooting.

## Criticism of police

Law enforcement has faced widespread criticism for their response to the shooting. Many have called for greater accountability and transparency.

# Law enforcement failures and controversies

## Confronting the shooter

There has been controversy over law enforcement's delay in confronting the shooter. Many have questioned why officers did not enter the classroom sooner.

## Inaccurate initial statements by Texas authorities

Texas authorities have faced criticism for making inaccurate initial statements about the shooting. These statements included claims that Ramos had been confronted by a school police officer before entering the classroom.

## City Hall meeting with Steve McCraw on June 2

A meeting was held at Uvalde City Hall on June 2 to discuss the shooting and law enforcement's response. The meeting was attended by Steve McCraw, the director of the Texas DPS.

# Responses

## Ramos' parents

Ramos' parents have apologized for their son's actions.

## Survivors and families

Survivors and families of the victims have spoken out about their experiences and called for greater action to prevent similar shootings.

## Reactions from politicians

Politicians have reacted to the shooting with calls for greater gun control and improved school safety.

## Resulting gun control discussions

The shooting has sparked intense discussions about gun control. Many have called for greater restrictions on the sale of firearms and improved background checks.

### Political

The shooting has become a highly politicized issue, with many Democrats calling for greater gun control and many Republicans opposing such measures.

### NRA and Daniel Defense

The National Rifle Association (NRA) and Daniel Defense, the manufacturer of the rifle used in the shooting, have faced criticism for their role in promoting the sale of firearms.

### Mass shooting survivors and families

Survivors and families of mass shooting victims have spoken out about their experiences and called for greater action to prevent similar shootings.

### Entertainment

The entertainment industry has responded to the shooting with calls for greater action to prevent similar shootings.

## Legislative action

### Canada

The Canadian government has announced plans to ban the sale of certain types of firearms.

### United States

The U.S. Senate has passed a bipartisan bill aimed at improving gun safety.

### Protecting Our Kids Act

The Protecting Our Kids Act is a bill aimed at improving gun safety and preventing mass shootings.

### Bipartisan Safer Communities Act

The Bipartisan Safer Communities Act is a bill aimed at improving gun safety and preventing mass shootings.

# Legacy

The Uvalde school shooting will be remembered as one of the deadliest school shootings in U.S. history. It has sparked widespread outrage and calls for greater action to prevent similar shootings.

The Russo-Ukrainian War is an ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine that began in 2014. The conflict has resulted in significant human suffering, with thousands of people killed, injured, or displaced. This article provides an overview of the casualties of the war, including deaths, injuries, missing persons, and other consequences of the conflict.

# Russian annexation of Crimea

The Russian annexation of Crimea in March 2014 marked the beginning of the Russo-Ukrainian War. The annexation was widely condemned by the international community, and it led to a significant escalation of tensions between Russia and Ukraine. The annexation resulted in the displacement of thousands of people, particularly those who opposed the Russian occupation.

article:
2022 Nepalese General Election

The 2022 Nepalese general election was held on November 20, 2022, to elect members of the House of Representatives, the lower house of the Federal Parliament of Nepal, and the provincial assemblies of all seven provinces. The election was originally scheduled to take place in 2023, but due to the dissolution of the House of Representatives in May 2022, the election was held earlier.

#Background

The 2017 Nepalese general election resulted in the formation of a coalition government led by the Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist) (CPN (UML)), with the Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist Centre) (CPN (MC)) as its junior partner. However, the coalition government collapsed in 2021, and a new government was formed under the leadership of Sher Bahadur Deuba of the Nepali Congress (NC). The Deuba government faced several challenges, including the COVID-19 pandemic and a severe economic crisis, which led to the dissolution of the House of Representatives in May 2022.

#Timetable

The following is the timetable for the 2022 Nepalese general election:

* May 22, 2022: House of Representatives dissolved
* May 24, 2022: Cabinet meeting decides to hold general election on November 20, 2022
* June 7, 2022: Election Commission starts voter registration
* July 15, 2022: Voter registration ends
* August 15, 2022: Candidates file nominations
* August 25, 2022: Candidates' nominations are finalized
* November 20, 2022: General election held
* November 25, 2022: Counting of votes begins
* November 30, 2022: Results declared

#Electoral system

The 2022 Nepalese general election used a mixed electoral system, which combines elements of first-past-the-post (FPTP) and proportional representation (PR) systems.

article:
Crash (Charli XCX album)

Crash is the fifth studio album by English singer and songwriter Charli XCX, released on March 18, 2022, through Asylum and Atlantic Records. The album marks Charli XCX's final release under her record deal with Atlantic Records, and is a culmination of her exploration of experimental and avant-garde sounds.

#Background and recording

Charli XCX began working on Crash in 2020, following the release of her fourth studio album, How I'm Feeling Now. During this time, she was going through a period of personal turmoil, including the end of a long-term relationship and the COVID-19 pandemic. These experiences heavily influenced the album's themes and sound. Charli XCX worked with a variety of producers and songwriters, including A. G. Cook, Lotus IV, and Jacknife Lee, to create a more experimental and avant-garde sound. The album was recorded in various locations, including Los Angeles, London, and Paris.

#Release and promotion

Crash was released on March 18, 2022, through Asylum and Atlantic Records. The album was announced on November 4, 2021, along with the release of the lead single, "Good Ones". A promotional campaign was launched, including a series of Instagram posts and behind-the-scenes videos showcasing the album's creation. Charli XCX also performed at various music festivals and concerts to promote the album.

##Singles

The album's lead single, "Good Ones", was released on November 4, 2021. The song received positive reviews from critics, with many praising its catchy melody and lyrics. The second single, "Beg for You", was released on January 27, 2022, and features a guest appearance from Rina Sawayama. The song was also well-received by critics, with many praising its experimental sound and lyrics. The third single, "Baby", was released on March 1, 2022, and features a more upbeat and pop-oriented sound.

#Themes

Crash explores a variety of themes, including love, relationships, and identity. Charli XCX has stated that the album is about her experiences with love and relationships, and the ways in which they have shaped her as a person. The album also explores themes of technology and social media, with Charli XCX using lyrics and sound design to comment on the ways in which these things are changing the way we interact with each other.

#Music and lyrics

The music on Crash is experimental and avant-garde, incorporating a variety of sounds and styles. Charli XCX worked with a variety of producers and songwriters to create a unique and innovative sound, which incorporates elements of pop, electronic, and rock music. The lyrics on the album are personal and introspective, with Charli XCX using her experiences with love and relationships as inspiration. The album's sound is characterized by its use of distorted synths, driving beats, and atmospheric soundscapes.

#Critical reception

Crash received positive reviews from critics, with many praising its experimental sound and lyrics. The album was praised for its innovation and creativity, with many critics noting that it is one of the most exciting and forward-thinking albums of the year. Charli XCX's vocal performance was also praised, with many critics noting that she is one of the most talented and versatile vocalists of her generation.

#Accolades

#Commercial performance

2022–2023 Pentagon Document Leaks

The 2022–2023 Pentagon document leaks refer to the unauthorized disclosure of classified documents from the United States Department of Defense, specifically the Pentagon, between 2022 and 2023. The leaked documents, which include sensitive information on various military operations, countries, and organizations, have sparked widespread concern and debate about national security, intelligence gathering, and the handling of classified information.

#Background

The Pentagon document leaks are believed to have begun in 2022, when a series of classified documents were posted online by an anonymous user. The documents, which were later confirmed to be authentic by the Pentagon, included information on military operations, intelligence gathering, and strategic planning. The leaks continued throughout 2022 and into 2023, with new documents being posted online regularly.

#Document Dissemination

The leaked documents were initially posted on online platforms, including social media and file-sharing websites. The documents were later shared and disseminated by various news outlets, researchers, and analysts, who used the information to gain insights into military operations and strategic planning.

#Contents

##Russo-Ukrainian War

###Battle of Bakhmut

###Casualty Estimates

###Western Special Forces

article:
2023 Thai general election

The 2023 Thai general election was held on May 14, 2023, to elect members of the House of Representatives, the lower house of the National Assembly of Thailand. The election was the first to be held under the 2017 Constitution, which was drafted by the National Council for Peace and Order (NCPO), the military junta that seized power in the 2014 Thai coup d'état.

# Background

Thailand has a long history of political instability, with the country experiencing numerous coups, protests, and elections since the transition to democracy in 1932. The 2014 coup led to the establishment of the NCPO, which ruled the country until the 2019 general election. The 2019 election was widely seen as flawed, with the Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP), which was closely aligned with the NCPO, winning the most seats in the House of Representatives.

The 2023 election was seen as an opportunity for Thailand to transition towards a more democratic system, with many parties campaigning on platforms of reform and anti-military rule. However, the election was also marked by concerns over the role of the military and the monarchy in Thai politics, as well as the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the country's economy and society.

# Electoral system

Thailand uses a mixed-member proportional representation system to elect members of the House of Representatives. The country is divided into 400 constituencies, each electing one member using the first-past-the-post system. In addition, 100 party-list seats are allocated using proportional representation.

## Prime ministerial candidates

Prior to the election, several parties nominated prime ministerial candidates. The Move Forward Party (MFP) nominated Pita Limjaroenrat, a prominent businessman and politician, while the Pheu Thai Party (PTP) nominated Paetongtarn Shinawatra, the daughter of former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra. The PPRP nominated Srettha Thavisin, a former minister and businessman.

## 2022 reapportionment and redistricting

In 2022, the Election Commission of Thailand (ECT) reapportioned and redistricted the country's electoral boundaries. The reapportionment increased the number of party-list seats from 150 to 100, while the redistricting changed the boundaries of many constituencies. The changes were seen as favoring the PPRP and other pro-military parties.

# Leading up to the election

The election campaign was marked by intense competition between the major parties. The MFP and PTP campaigned on platforms of reform and anti-military rule, while the PPRP focused on its record in government and its plans for economic development.

The campaign was also marked by controversy over the role of the monarchy in Thai politics. In January 2023, the King of Thailand, Maha Vajiralongkorn, issued a statement criticizing politicians who were "using" the monarchy for their own gain. The statement was seen as a warning to parties that were campaigning on anti-monarchy platforms.

# Contesting parties

A total of 63 parties contested the election, including many new and small parties. The major parties included:

* Move Forward Party (MFP)
* Pheu Thai Party (PTP)
* Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP)
* Democrat Party (DP)
* Bhumjaithai Party (BJT)

# Overseas and advanced voting

Overseas voting took place from May 4 to 8, 2023, with many Thais living abroad casting their ballots. Advanced voting took place on May 7, 2023, with many voters casting their ballots early.

# Opinion polls

Opinion polls were conducted throughout the campaign, with many showing the MFP and PTP leading the PPRP. However, the polls also showed a significant number of undecided voters.

## Preferred party

A poll conducted by the Bangkok Post in April 2023 showed the following results:

* MFP: 34.6%
* PTP: 28.5%
* PPRP: 23.4%

## Preferred prime minister

A poll conducted by the Nation in May 2023 showed the following results:

* Pita Limjaroenrat (MFP): 35.1%
* Paetongtarn Shinawatra (PTP): 29.5%
* Srettha Thavisin (PPRP): 21.2%

## Exit polls

Exit polls were conducted on election day, with many showing the MFP leading the PTP and PPRP. However, the results were not conclusive, and many analysts predicted a close result.

# Results

The official results of the election were announced on May 16, 2023. The MFP won 151 seats in the House of Representatives, followed by the PTP with 141 seats and the PPRP with 117 seats.

## Results by province

The results varied by province, with the MFP performing well in the north and northeast and the PTP performing well in the south. The PPRP performed well in the central and eastern regions.

## Analysis

The results were seen as a significant shift towards the opposition parties, with the MFP and PTP performing well despite the PPRP's efforts to retain power. The results were also seen as a rejection of the military's role in politics, with many voters casting their ballots for parties that campaigned on anti-military platforms.

# Government formation

The election results led to a period of government formation, with the MFP and PTP negotiating with other parties to form a coalition government.

## Move Forward–led coalition

The MFP formed a coalition government with the PTP, BJT, and other parties. The coalition had a majority of seats in the House of Representatives and was seen as a significant shift towards the opposition parties.

## Pheu Thai–led coalition

The PTP also formed a coalition government with the MFP, DP, and other parties. However, the coalition did not have a majority of seats in the House of Representatives and was seen as less likely to succeed.

# Notes

* The election was the first to be held under the 2017 Constitution.
* The election was marked by controversy over the role of the monarchy in Thai politics.
* The results were seen as a significant shift towards the opposition parties.

# References

* Bangkok Post. (2023). Thailand's 2023 general election: A guide.
* Nation. (2023). Thailand's 2023 general election: A primer.

# External links

* Election Commission of Thailand. (2023). 2023 General Election.
* Move Forward Party. (2023). 2023 Election Platform.
* Pheu Thai Party. (2023). 2023 Election Platform.

article:
2023 United Cup
================

The 2023 United Cup was a mixed-gender tennis tournament held in Australia from December 29, 2022, to January 8, 2023. The tournament featured a unique format, with 18 countries competing in a combination of group stage and knockout rounds. The event was organized by the Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP) and the Women's Tennis Association (WTA), in partnership with Tennis Australia.

Knockout Bracket
---------------

The knockout bracket consisted of the winners of each group, who advanced to the host city finals. The winners of the host city finals then competed in the semifinals, with the winners of the semifinals advancing to the final.

Format
-------

The 2023 United Cup featured a unique format, with 18 countries competing in six groups of three teams each. Each team consisted of four players: two men and two women. The group stage consisted of a round-robin format, with each team playing two matches against the other teams in their group. The winners of each group advanced to the host city finals.

Qualification
-------------

The qualification process for the 2023 United Cup was based on the ATP and WTA rankings. The top 10 countries in the ATP rankings and the top 10 countries in the WTA rankings qualified for the tournament. The remaining two spots were allocated to wild card entries, which were awarded to Australia and Great Britain.

Venues
-------

The 2023 United Cup was held at three venues in Australia: the Ken Rosewall Arena in Sydney, the RAC Arena in Perth, and the Pat Rafter Arena in Brisbane. Each venue hosted two groups during the group stage, with the host city finals and knockout rounds held at the Ken Rosewall Arena in Sydney.

Residential Palace Darmstadt

The Residential Palace Darmstadt (German: Residenzschloss Darmstadt) is a former residential palace of the Grand Dukes of Hesse in Darmstadt, Germany. The palace has a rich history dating back to the Middle Ages and has undergone several transformations over the centuries. Today, it serves as a museum and event space, showcasing the region's cultural and historical heritage.

#History

##Middle Ages

The history of the Residential Palace Darmstadt begins in the 13th century when the Counts of Katzenelnbogen built a castle on the site. The castle was strategically located on a hill overlooking the city of Darmstadt and the surrounding countryside. Over the centuries, the castle was expanded and fortified by successive rulers, including the Landgraves of Hesse.

##Renaissance era

During the Renaissance era, the palace underwent significant changes. In 1546, the Landgrave Philip I of Hesse ordered the construction of a new palace, which was designed in the Renaissance style. The palace featured ornate facades, grand halls, and beautifully landscaped gardens. The palace became a center of cultural and intellectual life, attracting scholars, artists, and musicians from across Europe.

##Baroque era

In the 17th and 18th centuries, the palace was renovated and expanded in the Baroque style. The Grand Duke Ernst Ludwig of Hesse-Darmstadt commissioned the construction of a new wing, which featured grand halls, ornate ceilings, and beautifully decorated rooms. The palace became a symbol of the Grand Duke's power and wealth, and its grandeur was renowned throughout Europe.

##20th century to the present

In the 20th century, the palace suffered significant damage during World War II. The palace was bombed in 1944, and many of its buildings were destroyed or severely damaged. After the war, the palace was restored and renovated, and it was reopened as a museum and event space. Today, the palace is managed by the State of Hesse and is open to the public for guided tours and cultural events.

The towers are made of stone and feature a mix of medieval and Baroque architectural styles. The gates are made of wood and feature a mix of medieval and Renaissance architectural styles.

Saint-Domingue Creoles

The Saint-Domingue Creoles were a unique cultural and social group that emerged in the 17th and 18th centuries in the French colony of Saint-Domingue, which is now modern-day Haiti. The Creoles of Saint-Domingue were a blend of European, African, and indigenous Taino ancestry, and they developed a distinct culture, language, and identity that was shaped by their history, geography, and social context.

#Saint-Domingue Creole Society

##Etymology

The term "Creole" is derived from the Portuguese word "crioulo," which means "native" or "born in the colony." In the context of Saint-Domingue, the term referred to the mixed-race population that emerged as a result of the interaction between European colonizers, African slaves, and indigenous Taino people.

##Origin of the Saint-Domingue Creoles

The Saint-Domingue Creoles originated in the 17th century, when French colonizers established the first permanent settlements in the island. The colonizers brought with them enslaved Africans, who were forced to work on the plantations and in the mines. Over time, the enslaved Africans and their descendants intermarried with the European colonizers and the indigenous Taino people, giving rise to a mixed-race population.

##Saint-Domingue Creole society

The Saint-Domingue Creole society was a complex and hierarchical structure, with different groups and classes. At the top of the hierarchy were the white colonizers, who held power and wealth. Below them were the Creoles, who were divided into different subgroups based on their skin color, ancestry, and social status. Hardeep Singh Nijjar

Hardeep Singh Nijjar was a Canadian Sikh activist and leader who was assassinated on June 18, 2023, in Surrey, British Columbia, Canada. His death sparked a diplomatic dispute between Canada and India, with allegations of Indian involvement in his killing. Nijjar was a prominent figure in the Canadian Sikh community and was known for his advocacy for Sikh rights and self-determination.

# Early life and immigration to Canada

Hardeep Singh Nijjar was born in 1977 in the Indian state of Punjab. He immigrated to Canada in the early 2000s and settled in Surrey, British Columbia. Nijjar became involved in the local Sikh community and quickly rose to prominence as a leader and activist.

# Involvement with Sikh organisations

Nijjar was an active member of several Sikh organisations, including the Guru Nanak Sikh Gurdwara, one of the largest Sikh temples in Canada. He was also involved with the Shiromani Akali Dal (Amritsar), a Sikh nationalist party that advocates for the creation of a separate Sikh homeland in India. Nijjar's involvement with these organisations reflected his commitment to Sikh rights and self-determination.

# Allegations of militant activities

Nijjar was accused by Indian authorities of being a militant Sikh separatist and a member of the Khalistan Tiger Force, a banned organisation in India. However, these allegations were never proven, and Nijjar consistently denied any involvement in militant activities. Despite these allegations, Nijjar remained a respected and influential figure in the Canadian Sikh community.

# Death, subsequent diplomatic dispute and criminal investigation

On June 18, 2023, Hardeep Singh Nijjar was shot and killed in the parking lot of the Guru Nanak Sikh Gurdwara in Surrey, British Columbia. The killing sparked widespread outrage and condemnation in the Canadian Sikh community.

## Criminal investigation in Canada

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) launched an investigation into Nijjar's killing, which is ongoing. The RCMP has not released any information about potential suspects or motives, but the investigation is believed to be focused on possible links to Indian intelligence agencies.

## Allegation of Indian responsibility

The Canadian government has alleged that Indian agents may have been involved in Nijjar's killing, citing intelligence reports that suggest Indian authorities had been monitoring Nijjar's activities. India has denied any involvement in the killing, but the allegations have sparked a major diplomatic dispute between the two countries.

## Diplomatic fallout

The diplomatic fallout from Nijjar's killing has been significant. Canada has expelled a senior Indian diplomat, and India has responded by expelling a Canadian diplomat. The dispute has also led to a deterioration in relations between the two countries, with Canada cancelling several high-level meetings and visits.

## Reactions

The Indian Canadian community has been shocked and outraged by Nijjar's killing, with many calling for a full and transparent investigation. Several Indian Canadian organisations have also condemned the killing and called for greater protection for Sikh activists and leaders.

### Five Eyes

The Five Eyes intelligence alliance, which includes Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, Australia, and New Zealand, has expressed concern about the allegations of Indian involvement in Nijjar's killing. The alliance has called for a thorough investigation and has offered to provide assistance to the RCMP.

Bangladesh has expressed concern about the allegations of Indian involvement in Nijjar's killing, citing concerns about regional stability and security. Bangladesh has also called for a thorough investigation and has offered to provide assistance to the RCMP.

The Sator Square is a word square, also known as a magic square of words, that has been a subject of interest for centuries due to its unique properties and the various interpretations of its meaning. Ovens & Murray Football Netball League
=====================================

The Ovens & Murray Football Netball League (O&MFNL) is a regional Australian rules football and netball league that covers the north-eastern part of Victoria. The league was formed in 1893 and has since become one of the premier regional leagues in Victoria.

History
--------

### Beginnings of the O&MFA

The Ovens & Murray Football Association (O&MFA) was formed in 1893 with six founding clubs: Beechworth, Benalla, Corowa, Rutherglen, Wangaratta, and Yarrawonga. The league's early years were marked by a series of challenges, including the difficulty of traveling between clubs and the lack of a formal competition structure.

### Post-World War II

Following World War II, the O&MFA experienced a period of significant growth and development. The league expanded to include new clubs, and the introduction of a formal finals system helped to increase interest and competitiveness. The 1950s and 1960s are often referred to as the "golden years" of the O&MFA, with a number of highly successful clubs and players emerging during this period.

### 1970s and 1980s

The 1970s and 1980s saw significant changes to the O&MFA, including the introduction of new clubs and the expansion of the league's netball competition. The league also experienced a number of challenges during this period, including financial difficulties and declining player numbers.

### 1990 "Bloodbath" Grand Final

The 1990 O&MFA Grand Final is infamous for its violence and controversy. The match between Lavington and Albury was marred by a series of altercations and fights, with a number of players and officials injured. The incident led to a major overhaul of the league's rules and disciplinary procedures.

### Recent years

In recent years, the O&MFNL has continued to grow and develop, with a number of new clubs and initiatives emerging. The league has also experienced significant success, with several clubs competing at the national level and a number of players being drafted into the Australian Football League (AFL).

--------------------

article:
Gadar 2
================

Gadar 2 is an upcoming Indian Hindi-language action drama film directed by Anil Sharma and produced by Zee Studios and Anil Sharma Productions. The film is a sequel to the 2001 film Gadar: Ek Prem Katha, which starred Sunny Deol and Ameesha Patel in the lead roles. The film is scheduled for release in 2023 and promises to be an epic tale of love, family, and patriotism.

Plot
-----

Gadar 2 picks up where the original film left off, with Tara Singh (Sunny Deol) returning to India with his wife Sakina (Ameesha Patel) and their son Jeete (played by Utkarsh Sharma, the director's son). However, the peace is short-lived as a new threat emerges in the form of a powerful and ruthless adversary who seeks to destroy the family and the nation. Tara Singh must once again take up arms to protect his loved ones and his country.

As the story unfolds, Jeete grows up to be a brave and determined young man, eager to prove himself in the eyes of his father and the world. He becomes embroiled in a complex web of politics and intrigue, as various factions vie for power and control. Along the way, he meets a beautiful and feisty young woman, Disha (played by actress Palak Tiwari), who becomes his love interest and ally.

The film promises to be an action-packed thrill ride, with plenty of twists and turns to keep audiences on the edge of their seats. With its themes of love, family, and patriotism, Gadar 2 is set to be a cinematic spectacle that will resonate with viewers of all ages.

Cast
-----

* Sunny Deol as Tara Singh
* Ameesha Patel as Sakina
* Utkarsh Sharma as Jeete
* Palak Tiwari as Disha
* Manish Wadhwa as the main antagonist

Production
------------

### Development

The idea for Gadar 2 was first conceived several years ago, with director Anil Sharma and producer Zee Studios working together to develop the script and story. The team spent months researching and writing, drawing inspiration from real-life events and drawing on their own experiences.

In an interview, director Anil Sharma revealed that he had always wanted to make a sequel to Gadar, and that the story had been gestating in his mind for many years. "I wanted to take the story forward, to explore new themes and characters," he said. "I'm thrilled to have the opportunity to bring this epic tale to the big screen."

### Casting

article:
2022–23 Bangladesh Premier League

The 2022–23 Bangladesh Premier League, also known as BPL 9, was the ninth edition of the Bangladesh Premier League, the top-level professional cricket league in Bangladesh. The tournament was organized by the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) and featured seven teams. The league stage of the tournament began on January 5, 2023, and the final match was played on February 18, 2023.

#Draft and squads

The players' draft for the 2022–23 Bangladesh Premier League took place on November 23, 2022. The seven teams, Comilla Victorians, Fortune Barishal, Khulna Tigers, Minister Dhaka, Rangpur Riders, Sylhet Strikers, and Sylhet Thunder, participated in the draft. Each team was allowed to retain a maximum of three players from their previous season's squad, and the remaining players were selected through the draft. The teams also had the option to sign foreign players outside of the draft.

The teams announced their squads for the tournament, with a mix of experienced and young players. The squads were as follows:

* Comilla Victorians: Imrul Kayes, Liton Das, Mustafizur Rahman, and others
* Fortune Barishal: Shakib Al Hasan, Shafiqul Islam, Ebadot Hossain, and others
* Khulna Tigers: Mushfiqur Rahim, Soumya Sarkar, Mahedi Hasan, and others
* Minister Dhaka: Tamim Iqbal, Arafat Sunny, Shuvagata Hom, and others
* Rangpur Riders: Nurul Hasan, Afif Hossain, Taskin Ahmed, and others
* Sylhet Strikers: Mashrafe Mortaza, Najmul Hossain Shanto, Rejaur Rahman Raja, and others
* Sylhet Thunder: Nazmul Islam, Mohammad Mithun, Johnson Charles, and others

#Venues

The 2022–23 Bangladesh Premier League was played across four venues in Bangladesh: Sher-e-Bangla National Cricket Stadium in Dhaka, Zohur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium in Chittagong, Sylhet International Cricket Stadium in Sylhet, and Zahur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium in Chittagong. The Sher-e-Bangla National Cricket Stadium hosted the majority of the matches, including the final.

#Playoffs

The playoffs of the 2022–23 Bangladesh Premier League consisted of three matches: the eliminator, the qualifier, and the final.

##Eliminator

The eliminator match was played between the third-placed Fortune Barishal and the fourth-placed Minister Dhaka. The Fortune Barishal team won the match by 10 runs, with Shakib Al Hasan scoring a half-century.

##Qualifiers

The qualifier match was played between the top-placed Comilla Victorians and the winner of the eliminator, Fortune Barishal. The Comilla Victorians team won the match by 7 wickets, with Imrul Kayes scoring a half-century.

##Final

article:
Naval Base Hawaii
================

Naval Base Hawaii is a United States naval base located in the state of Hawaii. It is one of the largest and most strategic naval bases in the Pacific, playing a crucial role in the country's defense and military operations. The base has a rich history dating back to the early 20th century and has been involved in some of the most significant events in American military history.

History
-------

The history of Naval Base Hawaii began in 1899 when the United States established a coaling station at Pearl Harbor. The station was used to supply coal to American ships traveling between the West Coast and Asia. Over the years, the station was expanded and upgraded to accommodate the growing needs of the U.S. Navy.

In 1908, the U.S. Navy established a submarine base at Pearl Harbor, which became a key location for the development of submarine warfare. The base was also used as a staging area for naval operations in the Pacific during World War I.

Pearl Harbor Attack
-------------------

On December 7, 1941, Naval Base Hawaii was the site of one of the most infamous attacks in American history. The Japanese launched a surprise attack on Pearl Harbor, killing over 2,400 Americans and destroying much of the U.S. Pacific Fleet. The attack led to the United States' entry into World War II.

Current Hawaii Naval Bases

Today, Naval Base Hawaii is a collection of several naval bases and facilities located throughout the state. These bases provide a range of services and support to the U.S. Navy, including logistics, maintenance, and training.

September 2022 Armenia–Azerbaijan clashes

The September 2022 Armenia–Azerbaijan clashes were a series of military engagements between Armenia and Azerbaijan that took place from 12 to 29 September 2022. The clashes occurred along the international border between the two countries and in the disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh, which is recognized as part of Azerbaijan by the international community but has been controlled by ethnic Armenian forces since the end of the Nagorno-Karabakh War in 1994.

#Background

The Armenia–Azerbaijan conflict over Nagorno-Karabakh dates back to the late 1980s, when the region's ethnic Armenian majority began to demand greater autonomy from Azerbaijan. The conflict escalated into a full-scale war in the early 1990s, resulting in the displacement of hundreds of thousands of people and the deaths of an estimated 20,000-30,000 soldiers and civilians. A ceasefire agreement was signed in 1994, but a lasting peace agreement was never reached.

In recent years, tensions between Armenia and Azerbaijan have remained high, with periodic outbreaks of violence along the border. The two countries have accused each other of provocations and ceasefire violations, and have engaged in a series of military build-ups and exercises in the region.

The Armenian military responded with artillery fire, and the clashes continued throughout the night.

On the morning of 13 September, the Armenian Ministry of Defense reported that Azerbaijani forces had launched a large-scale attack against Armenian military positions in the Vardenis region, using artillery, drones, and combat aircraft. The Armenian military responded with counter-attacks, and the clashes continued throughout the day.

Over the next three days, the clashes continued along the border, with both sides accusing each other of ceasefire violations and provocations. article:
OMG_2 is a 2023 Indian Hindi-language comedy-drama film directed by Umesh Kulkarni and written by Kulkarni, Abhishek Bhalerao and Bhavesh Mandalia. The film is a standalone sequel to the 2012 film OMG – Oh My God! and stars Paresh Rawal, Yami Gautam, Pankaj Tripathi, Akshay Oberoi and Atul Kulkarni.

# Plot

The film tells the story of Kanji Mehta, a shopkeeper who files a PIL against God after his shop is destroyed in a natural disaster. The story revolves around Kanji's quest for justice and his battle against the corrupt and bureaucratic system. Along the way, he meets a young and ambitious lawyer, Suman, who joins his fight. As they navigate the complexities of the Indian judiciary, they uncover the dark secrets of the system and the true meaning of faith.

# Cast

* Paresh Rawal as Kanji Mehta
* Yami Gautam as Suman
* Pankaj Tripathi as Tripathi Ji
* Akshay Oberoi as Mohan
* Atul Kulkarni as Justice Rameshwar Nath
* Govind Namdeo as Makwana
* Piyush Mishra as Seth Govind Das
* Aparshakti Khurana as Aparshakti
* Kriti Sanon as item number "Pungi"

# Production

## Development and casting

The film was announced in 2020, with Paresh Rawal reprising his role as Kanji Mehta. Yami Gautam was cast as the lead opposite Rawal, marking her first collaboration with the actor. Pankaj Tripathi and Akshay Oberoi joined the cast later, along with Atul Kulkarni, who played the role of a judge. The film's script was written by Umesh Kulkarni, Abhishek Bhalerao and Bhavesh Mandalia, who also wrote the original film.

## Filming

Principal photography began in January 2022 and wrapped up in April 2022. The film was shot on location in Mumbai, Delhi and Gujarat. The film's director, Umesh Kulkarni, worked closely with the cast to develop their characters and bring the story to life.

# Music

The film's soundtrack was composed by Vikram Montrose, with lyrics by Shabbir Ahmed and Kumaar. The film features five songs, including the item number "Pungi", which was performed by Kriti Sanon. The song "Achha Sila Diya" became a huge hit, topping the music charts for several weeks.

# Release

The film was released on August 11, 2023, in theaters across India. The film received a U/A certificate from the Central Board of Film Certification.

## Home media

The film was made available on Amazon Prime Video on September 22, 2023.

# Reception

## Critical response

The film received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising the performances and the film's message, while others found it to be too preachy and predictable. The film holds a 50% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 20 reviews, with an average rating of 5.5/10.

## Box office

The film opened to a decent start at the box office, collecting ₹5.5 crore on its opening day. The film went on to collect ₹20 crore in its opening weekend and ₹35 crore in its first week. The film's total collection stands at ₹55 crore, making it a moderate success.

# Accolades

The film won two awards at the 2023 Filmfare Awards, including Best Actor in a Supporting Role for Pankaj Tripathi and Best Dialogue for Abhishek Bhalerao and Bhavesh Mandalia.

# Impact

The film sparked a debate on the role of faith and religion in modern society. The film's message of social justice and the importance of questioning authority resonated with audiences, making it a talking point in the media and on social media.

# References

# External links

* OMG_2 at IMDb
* OMG_2 at Bollywood Hungama

article:
2022 Atlantic Hurricane Season

The 2022 Atlantic hurricane season was a annual event in the annual cycle of tropical cyclone formation in the Atlantic Ocean. The season officially began on June 1, 2022, and ended on November 30, 2022. This season was marked by a below-average number of named storms, but above-average number of major hurricanes.

# Seasonal Forecasts

## Pre-season Forecasts

Prior to the start of the season, several forecasting agencies released their predictions for the 2022 Atlantic hurricane season. These forecasts were based on various climate indicators, including the El Niño-Southern Oscillation (ENSO), the North Atlantic Oscillation (NAO), and the Atlantic Multidecadal Oscillation (AMO).

Colorado State University (CSU) released its forecast on April 7, 2022, predicting 19 named storms, 9 hurricanes, and 4 major hurricanes. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) released its forecast on May 24, 2022, predicting 14-21 named storms, 6-10 hurricanes, and 3-6 major hurricanes.

## Mid-season Forecasts

As the season progressed, several forecasting agencies released updated forecasts. CSU released its mid-season forecast on August 4, 2022, predicting 18 named storms, 8 hurricanes, and 4 major hurricanes. NOAA released its mid-season forecast on August 4, 2022, predicting 14-20 named storms, 6-10 hurricanes, and 3-5 major hurricanes.

# Seasonal Summary

## Background

The 2022 Atlantic hurricane season was marked by a below-average number of named storms, but above-average number of major hurricanes. YRF Spy Universe

#Overview

The YRF Spy Universe was first introduced in 2012 with the release of Ek Tha Tiger, a film directed by Kabir Khan and starring Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif. The film's success led to the development of a sequel, Tiger Zinda Hai, which was released in 2017. The franchise expanded further with the release of War in 2019, which introduced a new character, Kabir, played by Hrithik Roshan. The most recent additions to the franchise include Pathaan, released in 2023, and Tiger 3, also released in 2023.

#Films

##Ek Tha Tiger (2012)

Ek Tha Tiger is a 2012 Indian spy thriller film directed by Kabir Khan and produced by Yash Raj Films. The film stars Salman Khan as Avinash Singh Rathore, a RAW agent codenamed Tiger, and Katrina Kaif as Zoya, a Pakistani ISI agent. The film follows the story of Tiger, who is sent to Dublin to keep an eye on a scientist suspected of selling missile technology to Pakistan. However, things take a turn when Tiger falls in love with Zoya, who is also on a mission to protect the scientist.

##Tiger Zinda Hai (2017)

Tiger Zinda Hai is a 2017 Indian spy thriller film directed by Ali Abbas Zafar and produced by Yash Raj Films. The film stars Salman Khan as Avinash Singh Rathore, a RAW agent codenamed Tiger, and Katrina Kaif as Zoya, a Pakistani ISI agent. The film follows the story of Tiger, who is sent to Syria to rescue a group of nurses held hostage by a terrorist organization.

##War (2019)

War is a 2019 Indian spy thriller film directed by Siddharth Anand and produced by Yash Raj Films. The film stars Hrithik Roshan as Kabir Dhaliwal, a RAW agent, and Tiger Shroff as Khalid, a RAW agent and Kabir's protégé. The film follows the story of Kabir, who goes rogue and starts working for a terrorist organization, and Khalid, who is sent to stop him.

##Pathaan (2023)

Pathaan is a 2023 Indian spy thriller film directed by Siddharth Anand and produced by Yash Raj Films. The film stars Shah Rukh Khan as Pathaan, a RAW agent, and John Abraham as Jim, a former RAW agent turned terrorist. The film follows the story of Pathaan, who is sent to stop Jim, who has stolen a deadly virus that could destroy India.

##Tiger 3 (2023)

Tiger 3 is a 2023 Indian spy thriller film directed by Maneesh Sharma and produced by Yash Raj Films. The film stars Salman Khan as Avinash Singh Rathore, a RAW agent codenamed Tiger, and Katrina Kaif as Zoya, a Pakistani ISI agent. The film follows the story of Tiger, who is sent to stop a terrorist organization that has stolen a deadly virus.
